definitions.definition: a group of countries or states that are controlled by one leader or government

examples.text: These invasions almost led to the collapse of the Roman Empire.
By now Britain had lost its empire.
The Japanese empire was quickly dismantled.
a country that is still part of the empire
the decline of the old colonial empires
The Ottoman Empire began to decline in the late eighteenth century.
The story describes the growth of the vast empire of Alexander the Great.

definitions.definition: a group of commercial organizations controlled by one person or company

examples.text: He has built a huge business empire from humble beginnings.
the staff who help run his hotel empire

definitions.definition: an area of activity controlled by one person or group

examples.text: All the bureaucrats jealously guarded their own little empires.

wordOrigin: Middle English: via Old French from Latin imperium, related to imperare ‘to command’, from in- ‘towards’ + parare ‘prepare, contrive’.
